channel.title: 5: Intro in OS on Operating Systems and C
channel.description: Recent content in 5: Intro in OS on Operating Systems and C

item.title: 5.1: Intro to OS using Linux
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld and Jo Vliegen)
item.description: 2.1 What is an OS and Why should we use one ? In the previous chapter the concept of interrupts was introduced. By using these interrupts it becomes easier to execute multiple tasks on a single processor. However, can you imagine developing a complete office-suite using interrupts ? If more tasks come into play, interrupts will not be the answer to our question. But guess what the answer could be: Operating systems !
